alert.note: Alert for Extreme Western Allegany; Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 3:14PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT WESTERN ALLEGANY...GARRETT AND WEST CENTRAL MINERAL COUNTIES... At 312 PM EDT, At 310 PM EDT, heavy snow showers were located along a line extending from Point Marion to 11 miles south of Uniontown to near Farmington. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. Localized heavy snow and blowing snow will reduce visibility to below one-half mile at times and quickly coat surfaces. If travelling, be prepared for sudden changes in visibility along with slippery and snow covered roads. Interstate 68 will be impacted by this. Wind gusts of 30 to 45 mph will accompany these snow showers. Locations impacted include... Frostburg, Keyser, Mountain Lake Park, Oakland, Westernport, Bel Air, Bittinger, La Vale, Lonaconing, Piedmont, Grantsville, Loch Lynn Heights, Friendsville, Deer Park, Accident, Elk Garden, Kitzmiller, Cresaptown, Eckhart Mines and Mount Savage.
